headline: Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Biscuit Crust
description: This delicious chicken pot pie with biscuits is a comforting dinner that's quick to put together with simple ingredients from your kitchen.

video.description: Comforting pot pie is easy to make!
video.name: Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Biscuit Crust

name: Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Biscuit Crust
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
3 cups cooked chicken, cut into bite-size pieces
1 (16.3 ounce) can refrigerated flaky-style biscuits (such as Pillsbury Grands®)

recipeInstructions.text: Gather your ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion, celery, and carrots and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in peas, flour, parsley, and thyme and cook, stirring constantly, until the flour coats the vegetables and begins to fry, about 5 minutes.
Whisk in chicken broth and half-and-half, and cook until the sauce is thick and bubbling. Stir in cooked chicken, and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer chicken, vegetables, and sauce into a 7x11-inch baking dish. Arrange biscuits on top of the filling.
Beat egg yolk with water in a small bowl. Brush mixture over the biscuits.
Bake in the preheated oven until the biscuits are golden brown and the pie filling is bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: My husband and I tried this recipe, and it turned out phenomenal! The flavor was superb, and the biscuits gave the right amount of flaky goodness for crust lovers. At first, I was surprised by how little filling there seemed to be, but after a few bowls that wasn't a problem at all.
The biscuits come out raw and I double the time and flipped the biscuits and they were STILL raw in the middle of each biscuit and we all got food poisoning.
We love this recipe! I like to get the box of Cheddar bay biscuit mix and drop those onto the top with a small cookie scoop before going into the oven. So yummy.
So good my family loved it,prep work was a little time consuming. But worth it.
Quick and so easy and is soooo good. I did the onion and I used a bag of frozen mixed veggies in place of just carrots. Loved this recipe.
Easy and taste great.

I have made this recipe over 10 times and we love it. The only thing I do differently is pull the biscuits apart (basically split them in 1/2) and put 16 biscuits on top instead of 8, that way the underneath doesn't get soggy and the tops are nice and crispy plus you get a bit of biscuit in every bite!
So easy and delicious 😋
I loved this. I used Cresent rolls instead of biscuits.

I love this dish. It’s easy enough to make during the work week, but tastes like Sunday at my grandma’s. Only change I made was adding a bit of garlic powder (minced would be great as well). My wife claimed she hated chicken pot pie - but now she’s a believer too!

I made it exactly as it was written, I like to do that out of the gate. Moving forward, I would double the thyme and increase the liquid. I would increase the liquid because as the dish cools, that biscuits suck up the liquid and I'd like more gravy over the biscuits. I would increase both the half and half (1 C?) and the chicken stock slightly (2.5C?).
Excellent and I loved the glazed biscuits on top

This recipe is fabulous in most ways, but the refrigerated biscuit dough on top did not work; it never cooked through even when I popped it back in the oven for an additional 20 minutes. However, the product UNDER the refrigerated biscuit dough is excellent! Next time, I will probably use puff pastry on top. Also, be advised that, if using raw veggies, the prep is very tedious. I might just use frozen next time.
Delicious. I added diced potatoes, garlic, can of cream of chicken, corn, and shredded mild cheddar cheese on top

I have not made this particular recipe, but my problem with recipes of pot pie is when I put biscuits on top. The underside of the biscuits are always still mushy when I take it out the oven after the intended time. How do I prevent that from happening, it happens with any recipe that calls for biscuits on top.
Made this last night and it was a big hit! Made up the filling earlier in the day. Then baked for about 30 min then added the biscuits. And baked another 20. So good!

This was so simple to make & sooo tasty. A definite do over for me. I did a spin on it & make it with leftover turducken from Christmas dinner. It was a perfect comfort food for the wintery nights here.
Did everything called for but the biscuits. Too much bread so I used crescent roll sheets. Just layed them on the top and baked. Was great and will do this again.
I made this and to make the filling even easier, I used one can of chicken and dumpling soup, one can of chicken pot pie soup, fresh chopped carrots, chives, and leftover chicken breast.
I absolutely love this recipe, eat way more than I should, LOL. Thank you for sharing it.
This recipe is amazing. Only thing I did was add a little corn and made homemade sourdough biscuits for the top. The taste complimented each other great. Love!!!! ❤
I did one potato, one sweet potato, one carrot, 2 stalks celery, half a large onion and frozen peas. Turned out great with Old Bay seasoning.
Made it as described in recipe except I did add a can of cream of chicken soup. Turned out great! Family loved it, especially the biscuits on top. Will make again.
Very delicious l will made it again
I am “learning how to cook”. Easy to make! Used Turkey meat. Used Pillsbury Crescent biscuits. Enough left over to freeze! Will make it again!!!

Good basic recipe. I amped the thyme with a homemade spice combo of thyme, marjorum, rosemary, mustard, paprika, cayenne, garlic , onion and salt and pepper. Added more salt and pepper. Used only 1/1/2 cups of chicken broth and added 1 tsp of Better than Bullion. Used 12 oz. frozen mixed corn, peas, green beans and carrots. 1 tsp. diced garlic in onion. The Grands biscuits were too much biscuits for the filling for my taste When I make the recipe again I'll change that.
Measurements are spot on. I used regular chicken broth... I also added a tsp of Better than Bouillon to the mixture. And a few more spices. Turned out excellent

Made it but didn't put the parsley or thyme in it. My family wouldn't like it so I used a seasoned pepper when I cooked the chicken and a Himalayan Garlic seasoning. The dish was fabulous, I just need some more seasonings-it was missing a salt flavor.

Absolutely loved it! I did change it up a little but not by much. I used fresh carrots instead of frozen. Instead of Parsley and Thyme, I used Garlic. Instead of salt I used seasoned salt and garlic powder. I also traded out the half and half for part heavy whipping cream/ coconut milk. Turned out Great! Especially with buttery biscuits on top.

So I made this recipe EXACTLY as stated. Everything was great - BUT the biscuits did not bake all the way through!! When I served the meal, halfway through my sister in law said "my biscuits aren't cooked all the way - they are doughy inside". HORROR!!! So I took all the biscuits, scrapped of the bottoms that were touching the filling, and popped them back in the oven on a baking sheet to finish baking them. Has anyone else had this problem?
Great base for a recipe! Needed a bit more seasoning for my taste so added chili powder and smoked paprika. Big difference! Would definitely recommend

Easy and delicious. I made a few substitutions to account for what I had. After cooking the onions and celery in butter, I had no half and half so I used 2% milk for the gravy and it worked fine. Also I used frozen mixed vegetables and rotisserie chicken, I made the whole thing in my cast iron skillet, like others had said, and it turned out great. I didn't bother with the egg wash topping the biscuits.
We loved it! I didn't have any half & half, so I used evaporated milk. It tasted great. Also, I made homemade biscuits for the top. They baked and browned nicely.
Tastes really good and fresh
I changed the half and half cream, to cream of chicken soup. Still tasted wonderful. absolutely perfect recipe, will make again %100. the hubby loved it!
Good recipe, I used garlic instead of thyme, and didn't cook the veggies all the way becsuse they go back in the oven for a good amount of time. Would make again.
This is great!!! Added 2 extra biscuits! Used frozen peas and carrots…Sautéed celery and onion…also used boneless thighs boiled and shredded! Super tasty!!! Twin 10 year old approved!
Made the recipes just as noted and it was perfect
So hearty and delicious!
I added 1 Tablespoon sherry to chicken mixture. Pushed it over the top
Family favorite. I don't make my own biscuits I use canned and add some flour to the broth mixture. Saves 30 minutes on prep time

I made this dish, but I use frozen vegetables (carrots, green bean and corn) and ,I also used heavy cream and I also cooked this in my Iron Skillet . I had already had biscuits from the day before and just added them to the top . This come out Wonderful!!! Will make it again.

Yum! What a delicious recipe! I have always made my chicken pot pie in a large bowl with drop biscuits so this is familiar to me. I use my own homemade chicken bone broth. The addition of the half-n-half really added to the dish. It gave it a nice, creamy flavor. Spices are spot on. I had just one issue in that the biscuits were still quite raw on the bottom so I ended up flipping them over and baking an additional 10 minutes. I think that helped. May just use Bisquik drop biscuits next time. I will most definitely make this again and again!
Very delicious dish, quick, easy and simply beyond being ~ just a good recipe, as is this is an excellent recipe...
Followed as written except for biscuits......made from scratch. Just ok for me, no real oomph. May be missing something.

I always start with the basic recipe. I try it first and when I make it again I tweek it to my likes. I added some precooked diced potato and some corn to my recipe. Try the honey butter biscuits with this recipe. OMG!! Amazing

This was a hit and so easy to make! We all love chicken pot pie but I'm always short on time because of the time it takes to make the crust. This solves my problem and gives me a quick and yummy way to make the crust.
Exceptional direction! Added just a scosh of cheese to top 5 min before end! This is gonna be a crowd 0lease for sure!!
We liked it, I think it had higher biscuit to pot pie than I'd like. I think I'd put a smaller roll of biscuits next time
Great make ahead freezer meal. Everything but the biscuits in a zip top once cooled. Take out in the morning or night before to thaw. And continue recipe.
Delicious! Added mushrooms

The filling is definitely fabulous and I would make it again. However, the biscuits do not cook fully when placed raw on top of the filling. The bottom half is raw, gooey, and inedible. Next time I will cook the biscuits separately on a baking sheet and serve the filling over them.

This is comfort food at it's finest. My family LOVES it! The only thing I do differently is to slice the biscuits in half horizontally so they aren't as thick. I don't know that they would bake through properly otherwise. This was a great tip that another reviewer had posted (thanks). Will definitely be making this recipe again!
I really enjoy this recipe. I reduce the carrots. For me it just makes it too sweet. I sometimes throw in mixed frozen veg too. I like less biscuit to filling ratio so I halve the biscuits.

I loved it! To lighten up the recipe, I used half the butter, 2% milk instead of cream and crescent rolls in place of grands. The sheet of crescent rolls that I placed on top are much thinner than the grands, so they cooked through without a problem. It did take around 30 minutes until the crescent rolls were browned.

Made it the same but added about a clove a garlic when adding the onions. I also added light dusting of Lawrys Course ground garlic powder with parsley on top of the egg washed buscuits and and extra dusting of just dried parsley before putting them in the oven. Definately was a hit!
It's amazing and my kiddos ask me to make this at least once a month
Use the honey butter biscuits on this from Pillsbury. Amazing!! I always add a couple red or golden chopped potatoes.

I modified just a little. I doubled the flour, broth and cream because we like the filling. I also baked the biscuits first for like half the baking time because I don't like a soggy bottom biscuit. This dish is awesome so easy and delish.
I make this dish every winter. There's not a thing I would change. It is the perfect comfort food for a cold night.

Added a few other seasonings and cooked slightly longer. 

One of the best dishes I have made :) so yum
It was ok. Not much flavor. Needs additional spices to be good.

My husband couldn’t have been more disappointed when I announced we were having pot pie. (He thought back to those frozen pucks he was served as a kid.) He picks peas out of everything and hates cooked carrots... Guys, he had SECONDS! Ate every bite. 
I did not have dried thyme, so I did a pinch of dry rosemary and put a bay leaf in while cooking the veggies to compensate. (Take out bay before adding chicken.) But I did everything else exactly as called for. Delicious, creamy pot pie with a flavorful, aromatic gravy.

The filling was great but I added sage and a tiny bit of tarragon. However the biscuit topping did not work- the top half was fine but the bottom half was completely gooey and raw. Sadly disappointing.Maybe just use a ready made piecrust. Wouldn’t be any more difficult.
Yummm!!!

I made this for my family and everyone loved it. I used canned peas and carrots, which worked fine, but fresh veggies are likely much better (as the recipe suggests). I did not have thyme or parsley so I substituted a dash of oregano which made it interesting. I used the refrigerated biscuits suggested and I had a difficult time cooking them through without over-browning the tops. I wonder if dropping the temp and extending the time would help this. I realize ovens cook differently (mine is a much older model that cooks hotter on the left side than the right), so this variable could be adjusted accordingly. I’m also curious how substituting frozen biscuits might affect this recipe. Overall, regardless of my lack of ingredients, this was a great dish that was both easy and quick to prepare.
We just made this and our biscuits were raw on the bottom cooked for 35 mins
I found this to be bland. It was good comfort food as a base, but I’d have to season it up to make it a satisfying go-to for my family.

I made it for the first time and absolutely loved it!
The recipe is very versatile and I was able to make the whole thing in a Dutch oven. I didn't have half and half, so I improvised and used half heavy whipping cream and half 2% Milk. I did add some diced potatoes... because why not? You can easily add or swap out any veggies based on what you have and it will still taste great. I almost threw in a Green Giant veggie steam bag, but ended up finding the peas in the freezer. One thing I might change next time is baking the biscuits separately, atleast a little bit, to avoid the bottom layer from getting too soggy.

This was SO delicious! I am used to classic chicken pot pit with pie crust, but I enjoyed this even more. The only thing I will do differently next time is to split the biscuits in half, and put one layer on the bottom of the pie and one layer on the top. But I will definitely be making this again!
It was delicious! I decided to be really fancy and use some of the biscuits as a bottom crust. That was a mistake! The biscuits never fully cooked. Other than my failure, the recipe was perfect!

I have made this recipe both ways, the fast and easy way with pre made dough biscuits and in pie dishes with pie dough. Great both ways. It refrigerates well for lunch the next day and the flavor even improves.

Made this according to the recipe, except that I took the advice of the reviewers who prebaked the biscuits for 5 minutes before putting them on the chicken mixture. Like some of the others, I made this in a large ovenproof skillet, which made it a 1 pot meal. I will do this again, but will probably play with the veggies and spices to kick up the flavor.
Delicious and easy!
I really enjoy the flavor butnot sure how to get the biscuits cooked all the way through. They brown nicely but are pretty doughy in the middle.

Delicious! I made one change for convenience. I used a package of frozen Steamfresh Mixed Vegetables (peas, carrots, corn and green beans), thawing them in the microwave and draining excess moisture before adding to the mix. Other than that, I didn't change a thing. We loved it.
That's a lot of parsley. Also the biscuits remained a bit doughy on the bottom but if I left them in any longer would have been too dark for my tastes. Other than that, very good.
Only thing I left out was peas, and it was amazing!! I like it better than with pie crust!!

Excellent recipe! Quick, easy and tastes awesome! I peel apart each biscuit at the center to create two thinner biscuits. The 16 biscuits fit my cast iron pan perfectly and the thinner biscuits cook better and are less doughy. I also add some frozen corn and green beans and it is perfect for my family.
Great recipe, really easy to execute. My boyfriend and I loved it
My husband and I loved it. I skipped the biscuits and added mushrooms which I salted along with the carrots and celery, etc. I also added garlic seasoning. Delicious!

The recipe was a hit!! I will surely make it again. I followed the instructions as far as I could. I added three diced cooked potatoes, and some Herbs de provance, and some italian seasoning. I did not have cream, so I used 2% milk. Made my own biscuits, which did not turn out that great, but will use a different biscuit topping recipe next time.
Delicious! I did add potatoes,boiled them until kind of tender cut them up and added to the veggies! Totally passed the picky kids test!

On my way home my wife called from hospital visiting Grandma that fell. Said was going to use Rotisserie chicken we had in fridge. Looked at app and saw this recipe. My family loved this dish. All six went back for seconds. Left peas out due to many do not care for peas, otherwise followed and loved it. Wish I could be as fast as others with prep,took longer than hour, but still learning. Love Allrecipes.
Absolutely delicious! I did not have biscuits so I used a puffed pastry sheet. Will use biscuits next time.
This was delicious! I cooked sautéed raw chicken rather than using rotisserie and it was still really flavorful

Pretty awesome..my chef husband said I nailed it! Made a few changes..frozen mixed veggies, cream of chicken soup, milk, poultry seasoning and chicken base..halved the biscuits and baked it at 350 for 15-20 minutes..perfect!
I used homemade sourdough as my biscuit topping and my family loves it.
another picture of what i made
I made my own cheese drop biscuits from scratch and also made my own chicken and stock, delicious recipe! 10/10 would recommend
Easy and delicious. I used leftovers (barbecue chicken, glazed carrots, sautéed fresh green beans) and added onions and celery. You could put just about any veggies in here and it would be good.
Great comfort food dinner. Hubby loved it too!
This recipe is easy and delicious!Three tablespoons of parsley is a little over the top and I would cut it in half next time but otherwise everything was great. It was a hit in our house.
I doubled the recipe and took out the peas, added frozen corn and broccoli. I cut the biscuits in 1/2 and it took 30 min. Hubby loved it!
This is a keeper!
Easy and delicious! Added 1 clove garlic to the vegetables. After 15 min making, flip over the biscuits to ensure they bake all the way thru.

I followed the recipe but also added more seasoning- garlic powder, onion powder, poultry seasoning, and a pinch of rosemary. I also used frozen “soup” veggies. My father loved it so much it ate a second serving! Yummy and easy recipe!!
this recipe was yummy. i added corn. & i will also half the biscuits next time. it took a little longer to cook & i feared they would burn

Made as written in very full 10" cast iron skillet except used whole milk. Instead of biscuits combined 1 cup Bisquick, 1 egg, and 1/2 cup milk and poured over top. Baked 30 mins at 375. Perfect seasoning and amount of liquid. We loved it. Thanks for posting.

item.name: Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Biscuit Crust
